question.title: Spring Webflux passing Multipart to next request fails
question.body:
I got this pseudocode:

serverRequest.multipartData()
    .flatMap(multiPart -> {
        final var valueMap = multiPart.toSingleValueMap();
        final var part = (FilePart) valueMap.get("somevalue");
        final var builder = new MultipartBodyBuilder();
        
        builder.part("somevalue", part);

        // This does not work
        return client.validate(multiPart);

        // This works
        return client.validate(builder.build);
    }));

So when I pass in the original `multiPart` to the next request, it doesn't work, whereas creating the a new multi part with a builder, it does work.

This is the difference in values:

I can see there is a difference, but I am curious if there is still a way to pass in the original multi part to the request to save some lines. This is how I send the request:

return createWebClient()
    .post()
    .contentType(MediaType.MULTIPART_FORM_DATA)
    .bodyValue(multiPart)

The error I get at the receiving end is that the part can not be read out, probably because the multipart is wrong for some reason.

question_comments.body: @M.Deinum Ah yeah I forgot that part when I was converting the real code to pseudo-code, I will readd it. But note that the builder method was already working, it's about passing the original multipart.
You aren't using the builder, you are passing along the FilePart not the result of the builder.build().
